fr:mainmatter.html:p: A list of all people with pages in my forest.

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: Adrian Tchaikovsky is an award-winning and highly acclaimed science fiction and fantasy author with works published at home in the UK and internationally.

I’m a current Ph.D. student at the University of Cambridge’s Department of Computer Science and Technology under Anuj Dawar and 2023 graduate of Yale University; I am currently conducting research in logic, mathematics, and computer science.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Aislinn Muller
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Deputy Head of the College Office; Senior Admissions Officer

html:blockquote.html:p: I am Professor of Computer Security and Head of the Department of Computer Science and Technology, often informally called The Computer Laboratory. I am also the Robin Walker Fellow in Computer Science at Queens' College, Cambridge.

My research work examines the security and privacy of large-scale distributed computer systems. Within this broad area, I am currently interested in the security and privacy of networked mobile devices, such as smartphones, tablets and laptops. I examine the security of the devices themselves as well as the security and privacy problems induced by the interaction between mobile devices and cloud-based Internet services. I approach this through the critical evaluation of existing products, by designing and building novel prototype technologies, and by measuring human behaviour.

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: My main interests at the moment are type theory, including Homotopy Type Theory, and its applications to higher category theory. I am currently looking at various definitions of globular higher categories and am thinking about semi-strictness problems and types of composition.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Alexander Grothendieck
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Université de Montpellier, Institut des hautes études scientifiques

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: I am currently a software engineer. Previously I was a postdoctoral researcher at the Department of Computer Science of Aarhus University where I worked on program logics for concurrency, and semantics of programming languages, logics, and type theories.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Alison Sinclair
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Professor Emeritus of Modern Spanish Literature and Intellectual History; Emeritus Fellow

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Amal Ahmed
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Professor & Associate Dean for Graduate Programs

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: My research involves the use of programming-language semantics and type systems for reasoning about imperative code, security, concurrency, compiler transformations, and provenance.

fr:mainmatter.html:p: Creator of the 1lab, Agda core team member.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Andrew Carter
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Fellow, Director of Studies, and Admissions Tutor; Group Leader, MRC Laboratory of Molecular Biology

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: My research makes use of techniques from category theory, mathematical logic and type theory to advance the foundations of programming language semantics and theorem proving systems. I have a long-standing interest in the semantics and logic of names, locality and binding. My aim is to develop mathematical models and methods which aid language design and the development of formal logics for specifying and reasoning about programs. I am particularly interested in higher-order typed programming languages and in dependently typed logics.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Andrew Slattery
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Funded under New Spaces for Denotational Semantics

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: André Cabrera Serrenho
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Assistant Professor; Fellow of Clare College

html:blockquote.html:p: I’m an applied researcher, focused on creating user interfaces that expand what people can think and do. My current focus is an augmented book which actively helps people understand, remember, and use what they read.

I believe personal computers can enable transformative tools for thought: environments that radically transform what people can think and do, so much so that we expand the set of thoughts it’s possible to think. I want to produce alien cognitive and creative powers—as wondrous and magical to us today as a modern visual effects artist might seem to a cave painter.

I’m an applied researcher, focused on creating user interfaces that expand what people can think and do. My current focus is an augmented book which actively helps people understand, remember, and use what they read.

I believe personal computers can enable transformative tools for thought: environments that radically transform what people can think and do, so much so that we expand the set of thoughts it’s possible to think. I want to produce alien cognitive and creative powers—as wondrous and magical to us today as a modern visual effects artist might seem to a cave painter.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Anna Philpott
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Professor of Cancer and Developmental Biology, Head of the School of Biological Sciences

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Anthony Snodgrass
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Emeritus Laurence Professor of Classical Archaeology; Emeritus Fellow

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: My interests include formal proofs of programs and functional programming. I enjoy figuring out why complex code actually works and formalizing why it does indeed so; but I also like the process of building better abstractions to manage software complexity.

My interests include formal proofs of programs and functional programming. I enjoy figuring out why complex code actually works and formalizing why it does indeed so; but I also like the process of building better abstractions to manage software complexity.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Charles Weiss
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Associate Professor; Fellow and Director of Studies in Classics at Clare College

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: My core interests tend to cycle around combinatorics, universal algebra, and category theory. I study functorial constructions of spaces from quasigroups, representation stability, and categorified invariant theory. I am also a proponent of applied category theory, in particular with respect to machine learning and formal verification.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Dana Scott
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Senior Advisor; Emeritus Hillman Huniversity Professor of Computer Science, Philosophy, and Mathematical Logic

fr:meta.name: institution

fr:link.title: Durham Institute of Research, Development, and Invention

fr:meta.fr:link: Durham Institute of Research, Development, and Invention

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: I study programming languages, type theories, and logics. I am particularly interested in applying semantic methods to prove syntactic properties of modal type theories and programming languages. I am also involved in the development of program logics for concurrent programming languages through the Iris project.
Dan Licata works on type theory (especially homotopy type theory), logic, category theory, functional programming, and programming languages.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: David Howarth
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Professor of Law and Public Policy

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: David Jaz Myers
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Center for Topological and Quantum Systems, NYU Abu Dhabi

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: I’m generally interested in what it means to be a thing, but particularly interested in (higher) category theory, homotopy type theory, and cohesion.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Donald Mastronarde
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Melpomene Distinguished Professor Emeritus of Classical Languages and Literature

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Edwin Thompson Jaynes
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Wayman Crow Distinguished Professor of Physics (deceased)

fr:mainmatter.html:p: Postdoctoral researcher working with Christine Tasson and Adrien Guatto.

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: My research interests gravitate around the Curry-Howard-Lambek correspondence. Mainly: linear logic, lambda calculus, category theory, semantics of programming languages, type theory.

fr:mainmatter.html:p: A PhD student of Lars Birkedal.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Fredrik Bakke
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

html:blockquote.html:p: I am interested in developing logical and algebraic approaches for understanding the structure of computation. Most of my work is centred around the semantic modelling of programming languages. In this endeavour I find that type theory and category theory are particularly useful in uncovering the structure of programs, circumscribing their possible behaviours, and relating them to various mathematical models.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Georges Maltsiniotis
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Institut de Mathématiques de Jussieu, Université Paris 7 Denis Diderot

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Glynn Winskel
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: University of Cambridge; University of Strathclyde; Huawei

html:blockquote.html:p: I am interested in scientific aspects of computing and reasoning, in particular proof theory, programming, and the connections between them. (If this does not ring any bell, skip the rest and enjoy this nice video by Veritasium: Math’s Fundamental Flaw.)

In particular the Curry-Howard correspondence, the connection between some aspects of programming languages and some aspects of mathematical proof systems, is in my view an active methodology as much as a foundation. The discovery of similar structures between proofs and programs reveals that there are similar phenomena at work in logic and computation, for which much remains to be explained and explored, providing opportunities for fertilisation and unification.

Harold Carr works in Oracle Labs on applications of verified credentials and zero-knowledge proofs. At Oracle he has also worked on blockchain scalability and safety proofs, cloud infrastructure, InfiniBand transport and SOAP Web Service Technology. He designed the pluggable transports, the asynchronous client and service APIs, and streaming I/O used in Oracle’s SOAP stack.

At Sun Microsystems he was responsible for RMI-IIOP load-balancing and fail-over in the GlassFish Application Server. He designed the core architecture used in Sun’s CORBA ORB and in Sun’s JAX-WS 2.0 implementation and the scalable socket communications architecture (aka Grizzly) used in GlassFish HTTP and IIOP. He helped write the OMG Portable Object Adapter specification and was chairperson of the OMG Portable Interceptor specification.

He has worked on distributed Lisp and distributed C++ with Hewlett-Packard Research Laboratories and Schlumberger Research Laboratories, was Chief Architect of Visual Lisp technology at Autodesk, and was a logic simulation consultant for Cirrus Logic. He holds a Ph.D., in Computer Science from the University of Utah.

Harold Carr works in Oracle Labs on applications of verified credentials and zero-knowledge proofs. At Oracle he has also worked on blockchain scalability and safety proofs, cloud infrastructure, InfiniBand transport and SOAP Web Service Technology. He designed the pluggable transports, the asynchronous client and service APIs, and streaming I/O used in Oracle’s SOAP stack.

At Sun Microsystems he was responsible for RMI-IIOP load-balancing and fail-over in the GlassFish Application Server. He designed the core architecture used in Sun’s CORBA ORB and in Sun’s JAX-WS 2.0 implementation and the scalable socket communications architecture (aka Grizzly) used in GlassFish HTTP and IIOP. He helped write the OMG Portable Object Adapter specification and was chairperson of the OMG Portable Interceptor specification.

He has worked on distributed Lisp and distributed C++ with Hewlett-Packard Research Laboratories and Schlumberger Research Laboratories, was Chief Architect of Visual Lisp technology at Autodesk, and was a logic simulation consultant for Cirrus Logic. He holds a Ph.D., in Computer Science from the University of Utah.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Hendrik van Veen
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Professor of Molecular Pharmacology; Fellow and Director of Studies in Pharmacology

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Ian Leslie
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Professor of Computer Science; Emeritus Fellow

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: My research interests include algebraic topology (especially stable homotopy theory and model categories), homotopy type theory and univalent foundations, category theory (especially higher categories), derived categories, modular representation theory, mathematical physics (quantum gravity), and computation.

html:blockquote.html:p: I’m a Mathematics PhD student at the University of Leeds. I’m excited about research in algebra, geometry and theoretical computer science, particularly in higher category theory, homotopy theory, algebraic geometry, algebraic and geometric topology, rewriting systems, complexity theory and compilers.

I’ve worked on several research projects in both industry and academia. I was an active developer of the GCC during my time working at MIPS LLC, and aided in research on graph transformations with Graham Campbell and Detlef Plump, as well as helping on formal verification of concurrent systems with Ana Cavalcanti and Simon Foster. I’m always happy to talk, so drop an email if you want to chat!

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Jacqueline Tasioulas
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Senior Tutor & Interim Domus Bursar; Professor of Medieval English & Scots

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: James Noble
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Victoria University of Wellington (Te Herenga Waka)

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Jocelyn Wyburd
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Professor of Language Learning and Director of the University of Cambridge Language Centre; Interim Head of School of Arts & Humanities; Fellow, Tutor & Dean of Students at Clare College

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: John Gibson
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Professor of Pathophysiology; Fellow and Director of Studies

fr:mainmatter.html:p: Associate Professor in Logical Foundations and Formal Methods at University of Cambridge. Formerly a Marie Skłodowska-Curie Postdoctoral Fellow hosted at Aarhus University by Lars Birkedal, and before this a PhD student of Robert Harper.
I am a Bye-Fellow of Clare College from February 2024, and have been elected a Fellow for the coming year.

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: My research interests mainly concern the automation of asymptotic calculus and complex analysis, as well as fast arithmetic. Besides, I am the main developer of the software systems GNU TeXmacs and Mathemagix.

Juan Block is College Assistant Professor at Clare College, and previously was a Janeway Fellow in Economics at the Faculty of Economics. He specialises in microeconomic theory, with a particular interest in game theory. He studies the fundamental economic incentives driving cooperation and reputation in environments where individuals only observe imperfect information about others’s behaviour. He also investigates the role of learning processes based on social comparisons used by economic agents to make optimal choices when they have limited information and bounded memory.

fr:mainmatter.html:p: Villum Investigator; Head of Logic and Semantics Group.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Lawrence Paulson
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Emeritus Professor of Computational Logic; Fellow at Clare College

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Lidea Shahidi
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: MRC Cognition and Brain Sciences Unit, University of Cambridge; Clare College
Postdoctoral research associate; College research associate (starting October 2024)

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Lise Gough
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Postgraduate Education Manager and Secretary of the Degree Committee

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: My research interests lie mainly in type theory, proof assistants, homotopy theory and constructive mathematics.

My main research interests are the Grothendieck construction and its generalizations, enriched category theory, 2-category theory and 2-categorical elementary topoi. I am also interested in applying category theory to logic, geometry and computer science.
Mathematician and computer scientist working in computational topology and geometry and applications to machine learning and data science.

I am mainly interested in geometric group theory and geometric/low dimensional topology. Some keywords include: non-positively curved cube complexes, hyperbolic and non-positively curved groups, finiteness properties of groups, combinatorial properties of curves on surfaces.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Mamuka Jibladze
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Tbilisi State University Razmadze Mathematical Institute
Head of Department of Mathematical Logic

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: Interests: Mathematical models of computation; denotational and operational semantics of programming languages and interactive systems; type systems and program logics for functional and concurrent computation; applications of category theory to computer science.
I am interested in semantics of programming languages, functional programming, recursion schemes, category theory, mathematical logic and type theory.
I am an Australian-born mathematician working on higher categories, operads, polynomial functors and their applications.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Morgan Opie
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Hendrick Assistant Adjunct Professor and NSF Postdoc

html:blockquote.html:p: My interests are primarily in homotopy theory and its applications to problems in geometry and topology. In my PhD thesis, I focused classification of complex topological vector bundles of rank three on complex projective five-space. I am currently thinking about other problems related to (unstable) vector bundles and how they can be studied using tools from chromatic homotopy theory.

I am also interested in homotopy-theoretical aspects of algebraic geometry, e.g. motivic homotopy theory. My projects in this area have involved analogues classical invariants (degree and Euler characteristic) in motivic homotopy theory. My interest in algebraic geometry goes back to my undergraduate thesis, where I studied extremal effective divisors on the moduli space of stable rational curves with marked points.

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: My research interests lie at the intersection of program verification; programming language design; and logic, semantics and type theory.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Neil Greenham
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Professor of Physics; Deputy Head of Department

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Nigel Woodcock
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Emeritus Fellow; President and Senior Treasurer of Clare Boat Club

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: I am broadly interested in connections between mathematical logic and category theory, with an aim towards applications to computational complexity. My current research is on defining comonads that provide categorical semantics for logical and combinatorial (co)-resources. These comonads capture logical equivalences and combinatorial invariants of graphs/hypergraphs in a syntax-free, elegant, and compositional framework.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Patricia Fara
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Emeritus Fellow in History & Philosophy of Science

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Patrick Nicodemus
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: University of Pennsylvania School of Medicine

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Patrick Nicodemus
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: University of Pennsylvania School of Medicine

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Paul Bristow
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Emeritus Professor of Computational Materials Science; Emeritus Fellow at Clare College

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Paul Edwards
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Emeritus Fellow; Emeritus Reader in Cancer Biology

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Pierre-Louis Curien
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Directeur de Recherche au CNRS émérite

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Richard Watts
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Bye-Fellow, Director of Studies in Computer Science

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Roel Sterckx
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Needham Professor of Chinese; Fellow, Director of Studies, International Tutor at Clare College

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: Founding Director of the Centre of Australian Category Theory

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Sanjiv Ranchod
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: St John’s College, Cambridge Computer Laboratory

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Simon Franklin
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Emeritus Professor of Slavonic Studies; President of the Fellowship and Fellows’ Librarian

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: I am a researcher in category theory, type theory, logic, interactive theorem proving and formalization of mathematics. I work on the interplay of logic, category theory, and algebraic topology, such as in synthetic homotopy theory. I have studied topos theory, internal languages and categorical semantics to enhance our understanding of the relationships between logic, type theory and homotopy theory, and make new bridges between these disciplines.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Srinivasan Keshav
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Robert Sansom Professor of Computer Science

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Stephanie Weirich
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: ENIAC President’s Distinguished Professor of Computer and Information Science

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: I am a postdoc at the Department of Mathematics at Stockholm University. My main research interests are in Homotopy Type Theory, in particular its semantics using (higher) category theory. I am also interested in type theory in general and pure category theory.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Tamara Follini
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Fellow and Director of Studies in English

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Thomas Sauerwald
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Professor of Algorithms and Probability; Fellow Director of Studies in Computer Science

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Timothy Chesters
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: Associate Professor of Early Modern French

fr:meta.name: institution

fr:link.title: United States Air Force Office of Scientific Research

fr:meta.fr:link: United States Air Force Office of Scientific Research

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: My research is motivated by the problem of giving good, practical foundations of mathematics and computer science. The goal is to have proof assistants that are worthy of their name, in bringing both a significant improvement over doing mathematics on paper and facilitating the development of correct and secure software.

fr:mainmatter.html:p: I study mathematical foundations of computation, through an algebraic lens. My research spans programming languages, type theory, category theory, logic, semantics, constructive mathematics, and formalisation.

fr:mainmatter.html:blockquote: Wesley K. Phoa is a solutions portfolio manager at Capital Group. His focus is on fund-of-funds and multi-asset solutions. Wesley serves on the Target Date Solutions Committee, the Portfolio Solutions Committee and the Custom Solutions Committee. He has 29 years of investment experience and has been with Capital Group for 24 years. Earlier in his career at Capital, Wesley served as a fixed income portfolio manager with a focus on rates-driven and long duration strategies. His areas of research responsibility included interest rates, monetary policy and financial economics. He has also been involved in the development of several fund-of-funds strategies and custom solutions for institutional clients. Prior to joining Capital, he was director of research with Capital Management Sciences and a quantitative analyst with Deutsche Bank in Australia. He holds a PhD in pure mathematics from Trinity College at the University of Cambridge and a bachelor’s degree with honors from the Australian National University. He is an elected member of the Conference of Business Economists and the International Conference of Commercial Bank Economists. He sits on the editorial board of The Journal of Portfolio Management. Wesley is based in Los Angeles. Los Angeles.
